job_title: Transfer Evaluation Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Communication from CFO, Town Hall meetings with President

pros: Small Campus and tight nit community
It is a friendly work environment
cons: You may be required to do many different things.

pros: I've worked in corporate jobs for most of my life. Holy Family University was a great place to land. I've worked here for over 2 years now. I enjoy the people who work throughout the university. The students are fantastic as well. Hardwork is rewarded. Additionally, the benefits and sick/vacation time are great as well.
cons: Project decisions sometimes have to run through groups and get lost in the mix of priorities. Outside of that, I would say the pay is average and nothing outstanding, but the happiness of employment here and lowered stress is well worth the paycheck.

review_title: Management is often out of touch with the needs of their stakeholders. Administration does not value its employees.
pros: Because the class size was kept to under 24 I was able to interact with each of my students.
cons: Class specific software is often not installed until the second or even third week of classes. The bookstore did not have expanded hours which made it difficult for many students, especially evening students to get required materials. My experience with the administrators was often frustrating because they will say they are in support of something but their actions do not bear that out.

review_title: Assistant Vice President for Finance and Budget
job_title: Assistant Vice President for Finance & Budget in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Challenging work.  Wonderful working environment.  Open discussions with upper management. Employees work and collaborate well with each other and all University departments.
cons: None.  My 25 years at Holy Family University were both enriching and engaging.  Was able to learn and enhance my accounting and financial skills each and every day.

pros: Kind, kind management, most students were very professional, cordial, and nice, pay was fine, hours weren't strict.
cons: It was a little insular at times, but generally, my job was very fun and I got a lot of experience from it.

review_title: Great people and students.  Employees important part of University growth
